content:
After a successful migration, you have the new Knowledge object and are ready to verify and set up key aspects of the new Lightning Knowledge base.

Check the label of the new Knowledge object. If necessary, change it to "Knowledge". Validate the new record type. Validate files migration in the Files related list.

Add fields to page layouts that were hard-coded to the pages in Salesforce Classic. Check how page layouts are associated to record types and user profiles. Add related cases, files, work orders, and work order line items if used.

The recommended fields for compact layouts are:

Title
Publishing Status
Validation Status (if used)
Record Type
Language (for multilingual knowledge bases)
Last Modified Date

Experience Cloud has a different routing mechanism. After articles are migrated to the new Knowledge object, review and set up permissions in Lightning. Create, Read, Edit, and Delete (CRUD) permissions apply to the single Knowledge object.

Manage CRUD permissions with user profiles and permission sets. Manage authoring permissions per user profile or permission sets. Adjust permission for individual files in the Files object.

(Optional) Set up which record types each user has permission to use when creating articles. (Optional) Set up validation rules to prevent certain users from modifying articles of certain record types.

Set up approval processes that check the record type and user and either route or reject according to your business rules.

Review each setup option for Knowledge in the Object Manager. Verify that the fields, record types, triggers, and other setup options are correct.

Communication Channel Mapping—Configure communication channel mappings for the Knowledge object.

Add field-level security, define which users can access fields as needed. Redefine formulas as needed after article types are consolidated into one object.

Update validation rules now that article types have been consolidated into one object.

After you’ve reviewed and accepted the migration results, train your team and roll out Lightning Knowledge to your customers.

SEE ALSO
Knowledge Article: Lightning Knowledge Migration Tool
title: Post-Migration Checklist for Lightning Knowledge
